Package elements

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
elements.Camera
public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
Camera class representing a camera in 3d space.
Author:
Aviel Buta and Yakir Yohanan

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private double _apertureRadiusSize
    The aperture radius size The more large radius size the more depth of filed you get.

  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera​(Point3D p0, Vector vUp, Vector vTo)
      c-tor receive 1 starting point and 2 orthogonal vectors (and normalized them).
      Parameters:
      p0 - starting point (Point3D)
      vUp - 'up' vector (Vector)
      vTo - 'to' vector (Vector)

  • Method Details

    • setApertureRadiusSize

      public Camera setApertureRadiusSize​(double apertureRadiusSize)
      Set the aperture radius size. The more large radius the more depth of filed you get.
      Parameters:
      apertureRadiusSize - The aperture radius (double)
      Returns:
      this (Camera)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the aperture radius size is not bigger then zero

    • setFocalDistance

      public Camera setFocalDistance​(double focalDistance)
      Set the focal distance - the distance from the aperture to the focal plane
      Parameters:
      focalDistance - The focal distance
      Returns:
      this (Camera)

    • setDOF

      public Camera setDOF​(boolean DOF)
      Set the depth of field, with depth (true) or without (false)
      Parameters:
      DOF - boolean
      Returns:
      this (Camera)

      Parameters:
      width - width of the View Plane (double)
      height - height of the View Plane (double)
      Returns:
      return the camera itself (Camera)

      public Camera setViewPlaneDistance​(double distance)
      Set the distance between the View Plane and the Camera
      Parameters:
      distance - the distance (double)
      Returns:
      return the camera itself (Camera)

    • constructRayThroughPixel

      public Ray constructRayThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      Generate one ray from the camera to the object and go through the view plane
      Parameters:
      nX - number of columns (int)
      nY - number of rows (int)
      j - column index of the point in the view plane (int)
      i - row index of the point in the view plane (int)
      Returns:
      The ray from the lens of the camera to the p(i,j) in the view plane (Ray)

    • centerOfPixels

      public java.util.List<Point3D> centerOfPixels​(int nX, int nY, Point3D pIJ, int depth)
      Calculate the four centers of the sub-pixels
      Parameters:
      nX - number of columns (int)
      nY - number of rows (int)
      pIJ - Center of a pixel
      depth - The depth of the adaptive recursion
      Returns:
      A list with four sub-pixels centers

    • centerOfMainPixel

      public Point3D centerOfMainPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      Calculate the center of a pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - number of columns (int)
      nY - number of rows (int)
      j - The current column in the view plane
      i - The current row in the view plane
      Returns:
      The center of the pixel

    • constructRayThroughPixelAdaptive

      public java.util.List<Ray> constructRayThroughPixelAdaptive​(int nX, int nY, int depth, int signX, int signY, Point3D pIJ)
      Generate the rays from the camera to the object and go through the view plane and the focal plane.

      The return rays is refer to wich quarter it is.

      Parameters:
      nX - number of columns (int)
      nY - number of rows (int)
      depth - The depth of the recursion
      signX - The X sign of the quarter
      signY - The Y sign of the quarter
      pIJ - The center of the quarter
      Returns:
      List of rays from the lens of the camera to the p(i,j) in the view plane (Ray)

    • centerOfPixelsDOF

      public java.util.List<Point3D> centerOfPixelsDOF​(Point3D pIJ, int depth)
      Find the 4 sub-pixels center of the aperture
      Parameters:
      pIJ - The center of the pixel
      depth - The depth of the recursion
      Returns:
      List of the 4 sub-pixel centers

    • findFocalPoint

      public Point3D findFocalPoint​(Point3D pointOnVP)
      Find the point in the focal plane
      Parameters:
      pointOnVP - The point of the view plane
      Returns:
      The

    • constractRayAdaptivGridDOF

      public java.util.List<Ray> constractRayAdaptivGridDOF​(Point3D focalPoint, int depth, int signX, int signY, Point3D pIJ)

    • constructRayThroughPixelDOF

      public Ray constructRayThroughPixelDOF​(Point3D pIJ, Vector vIJ)
      Generate one ray from the camera's aperture (rematch the starting point to some point on the aperture) to the object and go through the focal plane
      Parameters:
      pIJ - The center of the current pixel in the view plane
      vIJ - The direction vector from the camera, through the pixel, to the scene
      Returns:
      The new ray from the aperture to the focal plane (in particular, focal point) (Ray)
